reference.ref: Mollineda, R.A., Ferri, F.J., Vidal, E. A merge‐based condensing strategy for multiple prototype classifiers (2002) IEEE Transactions on Systems, Man and Cybernetics B, 32:5, pp. 662‐668.
Bezdek, J.C., Reichherzer, T.R., Lim, G.S., Attikiouzel, Y. Multiple prototype classifier design (1998) IEEE Transactions on Systems, Man and Cybernetics C, 28:1, 67‐79.
Chin-Liang, Chang. Finding Prototypes for Nearest Neighbor Classifiers. IEEE Transactions on Computers, vol. c-23, No. 11, November 1974 1179-1184.

generalDescription.type: Preprocess Method. Data Reduction. Prototype Generation. Noise Filter.
generalDescription.objective: Reduce the size of the training set without losing precision or accuracy in order to a posterior classification
generalDescription.howWork: This algorithm merges the prototypes of the same class whose clusters are nearest. The list of clusters is recomputed each time that it makes a merge. The centroids are added to resulting set. The initial clustering algorithm consist on clustering in groups of 4 prototoypes with same class. The algorithm stops when one pass has produced no merge.
